title: School Covid Protocols
description:
Hi parents, 

Here is an update and a reminder on some protocols during this time. 

1 Children who are unwell are to return with no symptoms and are required take ART's before returning back to school.

2. ART's are not required if an MC is provided. Children are to return once MC is cleared and have no symptoms. 

3. If Household member has been tested Covid positive, please do inform the school, and we can provide you with the steps to take before your child comes to school. The school encourages all children to stay home until negative results of the household member. This also applies for all staff members of the school. 

4. If household members are placed on HRN, please also provide information and ART negative results of the household member before the children return back to school, this is to help us take the precautionary measures needed. 

5. Arrivals and pick up in school, please adhere to your policies to the ONE parent/caregiver drop off and pick up protocols. ONLY parents with siblings in school are allowed one parent each. 

6. Please do include names and dates on ART test when sending it over to the teachers. Dates are necessary to avoid confusion. 

Thank you everyone for helping us with these policies, we are trying out best to keep everything under control and keep the school as clean and safe as possible for all those here. 

Thank you 
Ms Shobi

title: SOP’s for returning back to school
description:
Hi parents! 

As the flu season is here, please be mindful on the following steps to take before coming back to school. 

1. Under ECDA protocols, children are to go to the doctor to seek medical advise. The school understands that parents have medications at home from the clinics from previous visits due to common cold and flu like symptoms. With this, children with flu like symptoms that have been brought to our attention or sent home from school can only return to school when there are no symptoms and they are required to produce a negative ART test the night before or morning off the return. 

2. Siblings of children who were sent back home, will also have to be picked up and can return back to school when household member produces a negative ART result. This goes with any household member who is unwell. 

3. If children are not able to carry out ART’s, Mc’s are required and must be completed before returning. Children who still have symptoms are to have follow ups with the same doctor to determine if fit for school. 

We would like to also take this opportunity to thank all the parents for the support and the help to follow these steps. 

Jeet’s will carry on disinfecting and keeping the school as clean and safe for the kids

title: Protecting Our Children from COVID-19 through Vaccination
description:
As shared earlier, from 6 January 2022, parents/guardians of all children aged 5 to 8, including those enrolled in ECDA licensed preschools, may proceed to register their interest on the MOH National Appointment System (NAS) at child.vaccine.gov.sg.  After registration, parents/guardians can expect to receive a unique link via SMS within 3 to 5 working days to book a vaccination appointment.  Children who turn 5 in 2022 must have crossed their 5th birthday before they are eligible to book an appointment and receive the vaccination.
 
Here is a reminder from ECDA  that registration starts tomorrow (6 Jan).

title: Updated health protocols for preschool children
description:
Dear Parents/ Guardians,

Please read attached letter from ECDA regarding updated protocols.
------

In line with MTF’s direction, we have updated the health protocols for preschool children who are confirmed COVID-19 cases and close contacts of confirmed COVID-19 cases (please see Annex). These changes are primarily to align with national requirements for children tested positive (via PCR or ART), and allow children who are contacts of positive cases to return to preschool if they test ART negative each day before entering the preschool during the relevant periods. Notwithstanding this, we encourage parents to keep their children who are contacts of positive cases at home, if they can. If a child is unable to take the ART, he/she will be placed on Leave of Absence for the relevant period. These revised protocols will take effect from 11 October 2021.

title: Arrival Checks and Send home Measures
description:
Dear Parent/s, 

Please be aware of our heightened measures for arrival checks and send home measures. 

Teachers during arrival will bring to your attention the following: 

1. Runny nose symptoms - wet nose, flowing mucus, colour mucus. 
2. Spots on hands, mouth and feet. 
3. Fever  

If any of following is present, your child will be ask to go home. In the event, if the child is medically diagnosed with sinus infections, the teachers will monitor for 30 mins or more to check if it is a sinus flare up. If there is no change in the symptoms present, the school will require your child to be picked up. 

During school hours, if any symptoms are present, the teachers will contact you to pick your child up. On some occasions, we will monitor for 30 mins to an hour before requesting for your child to be picked up. 

If MC's are provided, please update your main teaches and make sure your child stays home for the duration of the MC, unless stated otherwise. The school would require a snap shot or a copy of the MC. If ART/PCR test were taken, the school would require the results as well.  

We do understand the inconvenience and we do hope we can work together to break cycles like these. 

Thank you
Ms Shobi

title: New Measures for Covid-19 - 27 September 2021
description:
Dear Parents, 

Please read the attached letter from ECDA, to keep the preschool community safe and slow down transmission, we will further tighten safe management measures in preschools for this period from Monday, 27 September.

School will remain open to support parents who need to work. As work-from-home will be the default mode at workplaces, parents are encouraged to keep their children at home during this period, where possible. 

ATTENDANCE

Parents are to inform your main teachers if your child is staying home during this time, or requiring services by the school. Home based learning will only take place if more than 50% of the children are at home. We will try out best to facilitate both in school and home learning if needed. 

ENRICHMENT 

1. Enrichment that is suspended will be Ready Steady Go until the 10th of October. 
Speech and drama and Readings class are able to carry on as it's done by in house teachers. 

PHOTO TAKING 

2. School Photo taking schedules on the 5th of October will carry on as it is done by a vaccinated member of the company, but if the attendance is low we will postpone it till after the 10th of October. 

SHOWER 

3. We have been encouraged by the safe distancing officer to switch out showering options to need basis only but after much discussion and based on the school having  carried out shower for all levels on a one to one basis, showering facilities will switch to rinse only for full day children for all levels. 

LOA for child/staff with household member unwell. 

4. [Tightened] For child/ staff with any household member who is unwell with flu-like symptoms.
As many of the cases in preschools so far have arisen due to household transmissions, a child/staff with household members (aged 6 years and above) who are unwell (with fever and/ or flu-like symptoms such as cough, runny nose, sore throat, shortness of breath) will be placed on LOA. The child may return to the preschool after the unwell household member is tested negative for COVID-19 (either Polymerase Chain Reaction (PCR) or Antigen Rapid Test (ART)).

Drop off/ Pick up

5. For drop off/ pick timings, we are strictly following a one parent/caregiver policy. Those in cars, the second parent can wait in the car, but for those walking in, we are restricting to only one parent walking into the drive way. Please take note, as teachers on arrival duty will inform the other parent to wait outside the front main gate. 
No siblings (above 6) are allowed as well. 

We thank parents for the cooperation during this time.

title: ART kits and Regular Testing for Preschool Staff.
description:
Dear Parents, 

The schools has received all the Antigen Rapid Test (ART) kids for the children and Staff. Kits will be packed individually in a disinfected area and provided to the children next week. Each child will be receiving 3 Antigen Rapid Test (ART)kits. 

Regular testing of preschool staff: 

Beyond vaccination, regular testing using Antigen Rapid Test (ART) provides a useful
form of surveillance so that COVID-19 infections can be detected earlier and ring-fenced
quickly to reduce the risk of widespread transmission within preschools. 

All Jeet's staff and vendors are full vaccinated and will be undergoing weekly supervised ART testing. 

Thank you !

title: SUSPENSION OF HEATH SCREENING PROGRAMME IN PRESCHOOLS
description:
SUSPENSION OF HEATH SCREENING PROGRAMME IN PRESCHOOLS
 
        The Health Promotion Board (HPB) provides vision screening, dental screening and health talks on tips for good vision, oral health and healthy diet for students in preschools and kindergartens.
 
2       In line with the Early Childhood Development Agency’s (EDCA) safe management measures, visitors including HPB staff and appointed screening vendors have remained restricted from entering preschools since 8 May 2021. HPB will continue to suspend these services until further notice, while monitoring the situation to decide when the services can resume.
 
3       Parents with concerns about their child’s vision are encouraged to bring their child to see an optometrist or eye doctor for comprehensive assessment.
 
4       You may refer to the attached letter and advisory from HPB for more information.  We seek your assistance to disseminate the letter and advisory to parents.  Thank you.

title: Updated Measures
description:
Dear Parents,

Please take note of the following measures that will be in place due to the new measures sent by Ecda, 

1. Mask wearing is still mandatory for all 2 and above. Children are to come to school wearing a mask before entering to our centre. 
Children and staff who display any symptoms - flu, fever etc will be asked to stay home till recovered.

Any parents who have been alerted for exposure or given stay home notice is to inform the centre as children will also be under SHN/LOA's. 

2. Safe distancing between the children within the classroom as much as we are able too. 

3. Please do take note that only one parent is allowed for pick up and drop off. 

4. During pick and drop off, we are reducing the number of families to 2 at a time allowed at the lobby gate. If there are parents/ children at the gate, please wait in the drive way if there are children playing in the playground. Please inform all caregivers on the measures. 

5. Visitor restrictions – Parents are still not allowed in the school premises at the moment and all parent-teacher conferences that are scheduled for end of May/ Early June are to be carried out via teleconferences or online engagement. Visitors for enquiries will also be suspended till further notice. 

6. Enrichment programs are ongoing as our ready steady instructors have no been inter mingling with other centers since the beginning of phase 2. Shields or mask will be worn by the facilitators during the programs. 

7. All celebrations in school will revert back to classroom celebrations and all whole school group activities will be suspended. 

We greatly appreciate that we have all worked together in making our school a safe place for all, so let’s continue to be socially responsible in our neighbourhoods during this time

Stay Safe! 
Jeet's

title: Back to School (Nursery)
description:
Hi all!

Hope the kids are all excited to be back in school on Monday! A few things we would like to update.

1. We have received an update that parents are not required to use the safe entry for the kids, ECDA will update the kids into safe entry via CMS (online registration site). Kids can come into school as per usual and we will use the kinder-connect app for sign in and out and attendance taking. Please look out for the tape markings and practice social distancing at all times. 

To avoid clusters, your main teachers will communicate with you to try and adjust some timings to help with the arrivals. 

Please take note of pick up timings as mentioned in the Reopening letter. Please stick to your timings. Main teachers will be at the entrance to assist with the social distancing between families. 


Pick up timing for Flexi care Nursery :

Playgroup:  11 15am
Nursery 1:  11 35am

Pick up timing for Half Day Students :

Playgroup / Nursery 1: 12 30pm
Nursery 2:  1 pm

2. All levels will only be using their own classrooms for activities - lessons, snacks, lunch and nap time. Classroom layouts have changed a little to accommodate social distancing measures between the children. 

Outdoor timings will be kept separate for each level. ECDA has asked that all kids keep their mask on during outdoor, or to wear a a face shield during this time. 

3. Please remember to pack extra mask in the bags along with ziplocks for storage and soil mask,  to help maintain the cleanliness of the mask. 

4. Do bring along their HBL activities and green carriers as well. 

We will update with some pictures on some of the measures we take and are practicing in the classroom within the week. 

We are excited to see everyone! 

See you on Monday!! 

(Attached reopening letter for those who did not read it)

National Heritage board would like to share with you a little history! 

Greetings from National Heritage Board!
 
We are pleased to share with you that in line with the extended Home-based learning month for pre-school centres, we have put together a series of short activities for pre-schoolers to learn more about our diverse culture and heritage through selected artefacts at our museums and Heritage Institutions.
 
To kick start the series, we are featuring the coconut grater from the Malay Heritage Centre this week. The activity is presented in PPT format, and when played on full screen, there is an accompanying voice over to guide pre-schoolers through the learning and activities to allow for self-directed learning and minimal parental supervision.

title: Weekend ideas for our Stayhome weekend!
description:
As the weekend is here and the need to stay home increases, Jeet's got you covered! Below are some links and ideas that can help with keeping busy indoors! 

First let's check out our Jeet's mummies and what they have created! 

1. Aari's mummy, Aarathi from The Party Elves created fun busy boxes that you can order during your stay home weekends! 
She has 3 different themes, An Easter Box, EID box and a Harry Potter Potions box! 

Check them out on her instagram page in the link below, if you are interested to order these busy boxes, email her at hello@partyelves.com to get your box today! 

1 box goes for $25 including delivery. 
For Jeet's parents you can order 5 boxes for $100! 

https://bit.ly/3dybZ2P

2. Eli's mummy, Michelle from Eli&Levi created beautiful original prints of animal watercolour illustrations flashcards! 
These numbers cards are perfect for all kinds of play, from sorting, spelling and number associations! check them out in the link below! 

https://bit.ly/2JijDAD

Here are some links of ideas and to download for the stay home weekend! 

1. We found some missions cards from @happytotshelf all about the coronavirsus! She has 5 other themes available for the entire family to have fun together! 

https://happytotshelf.com/category-past-learning-shelves-and-activities/


2. Using what you have at home! Big paper bag crafts. 
Tear open your grab food brown paper bags or other paper bags and you get yourself large papers for fun projects! 
Use them for painting, drawing and fun writing activities! 

https://bit.ly/2QP0XfT

3. Sensory Tubs! 
Using anything and everything! Sensory tubs usually are the best distractions for kids. Take different sized containers, a couple of ladles, and a jug of water, and you have yourself a sensory tub! Add some legos and the kids will be entertained for a while. 

https://bit.ly/2Unw3NH

https://bit.ly/39twRVS

4. As part of our afternoon program, we have recently added some mindfulness activities as it is a great way to help with restlessness, attention span and focus. Here are some links for mindful activities that you can do with your kids at home! 

https://chroniclesofamomtessorian.com/family-friendly-activities-resources-that-promote-mindfulness/

5. View 3D animals with your kids!
Ive checked the giant panda, lion and many more! 

If you type an animal into google, scroll down to wikipedia to select view animal in 3d! The kids can take pictures with them and take them for a walk as well! 

https://bit.ly/2UE3Ilb

6. Lastly, Attached are the Fruits theme task and a simple animal task by Jeet's!

Hope this helps with your stay home weekends!

title: Latest Measures by ECDA and Jeet's.
description:
Hi Parents, 

Please read the latest advisory by Ecda attached in this announcement. 

---

a. Students staying in the same household as a person who returned from any country to Singapore from Wednesday, 25 March 2020, 11.59pm, will be placed on 14-day Leave of Absence (LOA). This means such students must not come to school, preschool or student care centre from Thursday, 26 March for the relevant LOA period.

b. Students staying in the same household as a person who returned to Singapore from the UK, US or ASEAN countries1 on or after 14 March 2020 will be placed on 14-day LOA2.

Please update the school immediately if under any of the new measures. 
----- 

Please do take note that due to this new advisory we will in putting new rules for arrival and pick up times to avoid big groups. 

Arrivals for all children in the mornings
Please take note that arrival drop offs will done in smaller groups. If you see a parent/caregiver at the lobby area for arrival, please wait your turn at the drive way. We would appreciate if we do not a big groups at the lobby areas. 

We would also appreciate if caregivers/helpers do not linger around the compound after drop offs. 

Flexi care groups 
All Flexi care students will be split into two groups for pick up timings.
Playgroup class pick up schedule will be at 1115am. 
Nursery 1 pick up will be at 1130am as per usual. 

Half day Group 
Pick up timings for half day groups are usually between 1230 to 130pm. 
Please take note that if you see a parent/caregiver at the pick up point, please wait at the drive way before coming to pick your child up. We will take turns for pick ups. We do understand that this might delay arrivals and pick up timings but we seek your understanding during this time. 

Full day group 
Pick up timings vary between 430 to 7pm. 
Pick ups are usually in smaller groups, but similarly to the half day group please wait for your turn at the drive way. We appreciate your understanding during this time. 

Thank you parents for your understanding and cooperation during this time and appreciate if you could update your caregivers/helpers about the new measures. 

- Jeet's

title: Survery by Play Beyond the Screen.
description:
Hi Parents, 

(Below is a group of students who require some help for a survery for their final year project - please do check out the document attached. Scan the QR code to help fill out the survey!) 

We are a group of final year students from Nanyang Technological University, Wee Kim Wee School of Communication and Information and we are just a hundred respondents shy of our target number. Here's requesting for your help in spreading a word, if possible! 😊
 
The purpose of this short 5-10 minute survey is to understand parents' knowledge, attitudes, and behaviours regarding screen time usage among children aged 1 to 5, in order for us to better evaluate our campaign and reassess our messaging better. 

All participants stand a chance to win a family staycation at Wanderlust Hotel worth $275 should they opt-in for a lucky draw at the end of the questionnaire.

Thank you for helping us and we wish you a lovely day ahead!

description:
Hi Parents! 

For those who have submitted the declaration forms thank you! Keep them coming as the school requires to submit them to Ecda by the end of the week. 

We appreciate efforts everyone is taking to help maintain the environment for the children and staff of the school. 

Here are some of the precautionary measures the school will be doing during this period - 

1. During Arrival, we do hope parents will understand that children who show signs of nasal congestions, coughs, runny nose and fever will be sent home and encouraged to only return to school when recovered. We do hope for your understanding in this matter. 

2. Temperatures and health checks will be done throughout the day. 

3. Group activities like waterplay will be suspended till further notice. 

4. Field trips planned for February has been postponed as well. 

5. We are working closely with Ecda and hope that if any family has had contact with family or friends who have recently been to China during this time, please do inform the school for us to inform you of the proper protocols. 

6. Most importantly, we will continue with our practice of regular hand washing and sanitising of hands. 

7. Every Evening, the school environment and materials will be disinfected with Sanitize.  

Thank you! 
Jeet's!

title: ECDA UPDATE : Leave of Absense for Parents/ Children
description:
Dear Parents, 

Please read the following update from ECDA. 

NEW PRECAUTIONARY MEASURE: LEAVE OF ABSENCE FOR PRESCHOOL STAFF AND CHILDREN RETURNING FROM CHINA 
 
Child Care Centres will re-open on 28 January 2020, while Kindergartens will re-open on 29 January 2020, as scheduled.  The Early Childhood Development Agency (ECDA) will be stepping up precautionary measures for preschools to ensure the health and wellbeing of all children and staff in preschools, in view of the evolving Wuhan coronavirus situation in China. 
 
Travel Advisory
 
2       As the novel Coronavirus (2019-nCoV) situation in China continues to evolve, the Ministry of Health advises travellers to defer all non-essential travel to Mainland China.

Families with preschool children who intend to travel overseas, or have returned from overseas in the past 14 days, should declare their travel plans and travel history to their children’s preschool promptly, and follow other instructions from the preschools.
 
Leave of Absence for preschool employees & children returning from China
 
3       To safeguard the health of all members of the preschool community, preschools are to implement a Leave of Absence (LOA) of 14 days for employees and preschool children returning from Mainland China –
 
on and from 28 January 2020,
as well as those who returned within the last 14 days (i.e. from 14 Jan to 27 Jan 2020). 
 
4       This means that any preschool employee or preschool child returning from Mainland China during this period should not attend preschool for 14 days from the date of their return to Singapore, as a precautionary measure. 
 
They should:
 
declare their travel history to the preschool;
not report to the preschool during the 14-day period; 
monitor their health and seek medical attention promptly if feeling unwell. 
 
Illustration: The date of return to Singapore would be considered Day 0. The preschool employee or preschool child may then return to the preschool on Day 15. What this means is:
 
If you return to Singapore from Mainland China on 28 Jan 2020 (Day 0), you may attend preschool on 12 Feb 2020 (Day 15).
 
If you return to Singapore from Mainland China on 3 Feb 2020 (Day 0), you may attend preschool on 18 Feb 2020 (Day 15).
 
If you had returned to Singapore from Mainland China on 14 Jan 2020 (Day 0), you may attend preschool on 29 Jan 2020 (Day 15).
 
5       Preschools should provide paid Leave of Absence for affected employees, and monitor their health closely during LOA.       
 
6       For parents of affected preschool children who need financial assistance or support during this period, they should approach the nearest Social Service Office (https://www.msf.gov.sg/dfcs/sso/) or call the ComCare Hotline at 1800-2220000.

----
Please take note that declarations have been posted in the previous announcements. If any parent requires more clarification with travel declarations please contact Ms Didi directly. 

Thank you!

title: A note from Our Principal
description:
Dear Parents, 

Happy 2020!

We have published the 2020 schedules, class information, closure dates and some upcoming events. 
Main teachers will also be messaging contact numbers for easier communication. 

Some areas to highlight: 

1. The tents for the strollers have not been replaced as the shipments are delayed due to the holiday season. Please do take note that in the mean time, do take the strollers / bicycles home to avoid them getting wet. We are trying to get this all sorted in the next couple of weeks. 

2. Additional Subsidy changes. 

Due to the increase in the income ceiling for additional subsidy provided by the government,  the school has been provided with a list of children eligible to try and apply to receive a top up. We will be providing a form (form 2) to those in our list. 

If you have already received a SMS from ECDA, regarding the subsidy, please do let us know so that we can adjust the fees accordingly. 

3. Also, with regret we would like to inform all parents that our Dear Zhang Lao Shi has decided to take a break from teaching and will come back as a relief staff if needed. We would like to thank her for her 6 years of service with the Jeet's family. Ling Lao Shi and Shi Hui Lao Shi will be overseeing all Chinese lessons for the classes. 

4. Do look out for the Rainbow Party Circular coming out as well. Party is on Friday! 

See you all in the New Year! 

Thank you!

title: Creative Conversations: Shaping Our Future by Beanstalk (Downloadable links)
description:
Hi Parents, 

Creative Conversations: Shaping Our Future is set in the context of a fun and interactive journey of adventure, exploration and discovery.

Professor Alvis is an archaeologist who loves learning about buildings, tools, objects and people who lived in the past- particularly the early settlers; their occupations and more importantly, how they endured and overcame their hardships through determination, perseverance and resilience.​​

He and his niece, Bernice, spotted some sculptures as they were strolling along the Singapore River. Fascinated by them they decided to visit the National Museum of Singapore. A heart-warming adventure unfolds when something magical happens at the museum.


Download your kit today!

https://www.ecda.gov.sg/growatbeanstalk/Pages/Learning/Resource%20Kits/Creative-Conversations-Shaping-our-Future.aspx

title: Suspended activities as of 19th May 2021
description:
Hi Parents! 

*Re: Suspended Activities till further notice*

Please take note of the following activities that will be suspended as of 19th May 2021. 

1.  Water play will be suspended and switched to open ended play in their respective classrooms. 

2. Ready Steady go will be suspended till further notice. There are 2 pending lessons for May that will be carried forward to June after 13th June 2021. 

No payment for ready steady go is required for the month of June. The office will reach out to confirm June fee amounts by the end of next week. 

3. One to one Reading classes for students who will not be attending school during this time will have lessons replaced by Ms Jeet. She will contact parents directly regarding the replacement in June. 

4. Speech and Drama Term 1 has ended, Term 2 will commence in July 2021. 

5. Friday Library sessions will also be suspended till further notice. 

6. Spelling and homework for K2’s will also be out on hold till further notice. 

We will also like to take the opportunity to thank parents for the quick updates and support during this time. We will do our part to keep the children safe and to put all the measures into place. 

Thank you.

title: Stay home notices
description:
Hi parents, 

As we embarked into heightened alert, most of our measures set in place meet the measures issued out. 

1  Please do take note that all visitations to the school has been cancelled and for now only Teachers, gardeners , vendors for operations will be allowed into the centre.  Ready steady go has been given the approvals to carry on, children will be split into smaller groups during the session. Trainers  are only engaged to our school as to avoid any intermingling of schools. 

2   Only one parent is allowed into the school premises for drop off and pick up. Parent/ caregivers are not to wait around in the driveway area. 

3   A reminder to all parents that if any household member has been issued a stay home notice due to the current clusters, please do inform the school immediately as your child will be issued an Leave of absence during the same period/ negative covid test. 

The school will also update all parents on any stay home / quarantine orders issued to Teachers and children. 

Thank you and do stay home and stay safe Everyone! 

- Ms Didi / Shobi
